title: Roma close in on deal for Sofiane Feghouli as West Ham search for replacement
text:

Roma are closing in on a deal for West Ham midfielder Sofiane Feghouli. 
The Algerian moved to east London on a free transfer from Valencia during the summer but has failed to live up to expectations. 
Feghouli has made 15 appearances for Slaven Bilic's side and scored just one goal, which came against minnows Domzale in the Europe League. 
The 27-year-old's poor form cost him a place at the Africa Cup of Nations, and it is close to costing him his place at West Ham. 
Seven months after signing a three-year deal at the London Stadium, the Hammers are prepared to let him leave. Feghouli has one goal and one red card from his 15 West Ham appearances (Photo: Reuters) 
Serie A side Roma want an initial loan move for Feghouli with the option to buy at the end of the season. 
First, though, West Ham are keen to secure a replacement, and have reportedly sounded out Hull City's Robert Snodgrass as a option. 
Michy Batshuayi, who has struggled for appearances since his summer move to Chelsea, is also on their radar.
